means: 咬，叮( bite的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: Avoiding mosquito bites is easier said than done.
Tick bites can cause Lyme disease.
sentence.Network_cn: 被蜱叮咬会引发莱姆病。

sentence.Network_en: This cream contains a mild analgesic to soothe stings and bites.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种乳膏含有一种性能平和的止痛剂,能缓解被螫咬后的疼痛.

PerfectNetExp.abs: Don ' t scratch your insect bites !, 别抓挠被虫子咬的地方.
she was covered in insect bites ., 她浑身是虫子叮的伤.
his face was bulging with mosquito bites ., 他的脸上满是蚊子咬的痕迹.
she scratched at the insect bites on her arm ., 她抓挠着胳膊上被虫咬过的地方.

entry.def: If you bite something, you use your teeth to cut into it, for example in order to eat it or break it. If an animal or person bites you, they use their teeth to hurt or injure you.

example.ex: Both sisters bit their nails as children...
example.tran: 两姐妹都像小孩儿一样咬指甲。

example.ex: He bit into his sandwich...
example.tran: 他咬了一口他的三明治。

entry.def: A bite of something, especially food, is the action of biting it.

example.ex: He took another bite of apple...
example.tran: 他又咬了一口苹果。

example.ex: You cannot eat a bun in one bite.
example.tran: 你不能一口吃下一个面包。

entry.def: If you have a bite to eat, you have a small meal or a snack.

example.ex: It was time to go home for a little rest and a bite to eat.
example.tran: 该回家休息一会儿，吃一点儿东西了。

entry.def: If a snake or a small insect bites you, it makes a mark or hole in your skin, and often causes the surrounding area of your skin to become painful or itchy.

example.ex: When an infected mosquito bites a human, spores are injected into the blood...
example.tran: 感染病毒的蚊子叮咬人之后，孢子便被注入血液中。

example.ex: We were all badly bitten by mosquitoes.
example.tran: 我们都被蚊子咬惨了。

entry.def: A bite is an injury or a mark on your body where an animal, snake, or small insect has bitten you.

example.ex: Any dog bite, no matter how small, needs immediate medical attention.
example.tran: 被狗咬后，不管伤口多小，都必须立即就医。

entry.def: When an action or policy begins to bite, it begins to have a serious or harmful effect.

example.ex: As the sanctions begin to bite there will be more political difficulties ahead...
example.tran: 随着制裁开始产生严重的负面影响，政治上将面临更多的困难。

example.ex: The recession started biting deeply into British industry.
example.tran: 经济萧条开始对英国的工业产生严重影响。

entry.def: If an object bites into a surface, it presses hard against it or cuts into it.

example.ex: There may even be some wire or nylon biting into the flesh...
example.tran: 甚至可能有一些金属丝或者尼龙线勒到肉里。

example.ex: The car's tires bit loudly on the rutted snow in the street.
example.tran: 汽车轮子碾入街道上布满车辙的雪里，发出很大的声响。

entry.tran: （食物或酒的）浓郁味道，辛辣味
entry.def: If you say that a food or drink has bite, you like it because it has a strong or sharp taste.

example.ex: ...the addition of tartaric acid to give the wine some bite.
example.tran: 为增加红酒的口感而加入酒石酸

entry.def: If the air or the wind has a bite, it feels very cold.

example.ex: There was a bite in the air, a smell perhaps of snow.
example.tran: 空气非常寒冷，似乎有雪的味道。

entry.def: If something such as a performance or a piece of writing has bite, it is exciting or effective.

example.ex: The teams have that extra bite when they are playing against their neighbours...
example.tran: 这几支队伍与其邻近地区队伍交手时锐气更盛。

example.ex: The novel seems to lack bite and tension—even passion.
example.tran: 这部小说乏善可陈，没有紧张的情节——甚至缺少激情。

entry.def: If a fish bites when you are fishing, it takes the hook or bait at the end of your fishing line in its mouth.

example.ex: After half an hour, the fish stopped biting and we moved on.
example.tran: 半个小时以后，鱼儿不再咬钩了，我们只好换地方。

entry.def: A bite of something is a small part or amount of it.

example.ex: ...bites of conversation.
example.tran: 谈话的片段

entry.tran: 恩将仇报；以怨报德；忘恩负义
entry.def: If someone bites the hand that feeds them, they behave badly or in an ungrateful way towards someone who they depend on.

example.ex: She may be cynical about the film industry, but ultimately she has no intention of biting the hand that feeds her.
example.tran: 她对电影业可能有些怀疑失望，但终究没有恩将仇报之意。

entry.def: If someone speaks or replies to you angrily, and you think they are being unfair or reacting too strongly, you can say that they bite your head off .

example.ex: Whenever possible, suggest she talks about it but be aware she may bite your head off for your trouble.
example.tran: 找机会建议她谈谈这事儿，但是小心她可能会因为你多事儿而大发雷霆。

entry.def: If you bite your lip or your tongue, you stop yourself from saying something that you want to say, because it would be the wrong thing to say in the circumstances.

example.ex: I must learn to bite my lip...
example.tran: 我必须学会不乱说话。

example.ex: He bit his tongue as he found himself on the point of saying 'follow that car'.
example.tran: 他想说“跟上那辆车”，话到嘴边又咽了回去。

entry.tran: 抽出一部分，拿出一部分（钱）
entry.def: If something takes a bite out of a sum of money, part of the money is spent or taken away in order to pay for it.

example.ex: Local taxes are going to be taking a bigger bite out of people's income than they ever have before.
example.tran: 地方税收在人们收入中的比重将超过以往任何时候。

auth_sentence.content: Give me the guy who bites heads off bats.
auth_sentence.res_content: Give me the guy who bites heads off bats.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Give me the guy who bites heads off bats.

auth_sentence.content: It's not an incredible Pac-Man that bites everything.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's not an incredible Pac-Man that bites everything.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's not an incredible Pac-Man that bites everything.

auth_sentence.content: I will try to make my bites more readable.
auth_sentence.res_content: I will try to make my bites more readable.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I will try to make my bites more readable.
